subject: VAM linear motor order #SSN2822
description_text:
Hi,

I installed my pedals and haptics and am impressed.

I hadn’t managed my brake cables and pinched one of the VAM cables with the throttle:


It still works and I’ve taped it.  

Any chance I could get a replacement cable? Can the cable be cut and spliced like a speaker cable?

Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks, Scott


Sent from my iPad

conversations.body_text: Hi Scott Zeeb,    The connection is actually quite simple — the vibration motor has only two wires: a red wire (positive) and a black wire (negative). Just connect them correctly and insulate the joint properly with electrical tape to ensure there’s no short circuit.  If you prefer us to send a replacement power cable, it would be a bit more complicated, as it requires disassembling the housing, resoldering the internal wiring, and reapplying adhesive for sealing, which makes the process more involved.
